Starters.name: Burrata di Moderna
Starters.desc: A delicate sphere of burrata presented on a bed of rocket and fresh garden tomatoes, with whispers of balsamic and olive oil. Pairs exquisitely with existential contemplation.

Starters.name: Garlic Bread of the Gods
Starters.desc: Bread (sometimes homemade) is cut in a criss-cross fashion, and loaded with our homemade roasted garlic herb butter and finished with cheese. Pairs delightfully with marinara, but is also quite delicious on its own!

Starters.name: Curried Brussels Sprouts
Starters.desc: Brussels sprouts find themselves seasoned with curry and pan roasted to a tender perfection, served with a meticulously crafted tzatziki sauce for a truly restoring balance.

Starters.name: Hummus with Pita
Starters.desc: A creamy homemade hummus is married with homemade whole wheat pita bread. Is this a starter or a light lunch? That's for you to decide.

Starters.name: Chili Oil Silken Tofu
Starters.desc: A silken tofu block is topped with a crunchy chili oil and sliced green onions for a light starter.

Starters.name: Cheese Sticks
Starters.desc: Made in the spirit of pizza, an infused garlic and herb olive oil forms the base that is covered with cheese and baked to perfection! Pairs great with a red sauce side.

Pasta.name: Lasagna
Pasta.desc: Layers of pasta sauce and cheese are layered between homemade pasta noodles, then baked together. Each bite should be richly balanced and cheesy.

Pasta.name: Pango's Pesto Pasta
Pasta.desc: Designed in the honor of the boss cat himself, homemade pasta is tossed in a dazzling pesto full of ingredients that remain a closely guarded secret, much like the recipe for happiness.

Pasta.name: Tofu Cutlets with Creamy Vodka Sauce
Pasta.desc: Hand crafted paparadelle is the bedrock of this dish that includes a creamy vodka sauce with a touch of heat, and tofu cutlets that have been breaded and lightly fried to golden brown perfection.

Pasta.name: Spaghetti and Meatlessballs
Pasta.desc: Almost placed in the American dishes, it was saved by the homemade spaghetti that we make for this dish. Along with our protein packed special meatlessballs!

Pasta.name: Bolognese de Tofu
Pasta.desc: A certified staple, this dish involves topping homemade paparadelle with a slow cooked tomato sauce with ground tofu. This sauce has a rich complex flavor that you are sure to enjoy!

Pasta.name: Pasta Prima Vera
Pasta.desc: Hand crafted spaghetti finds itself tossed in a garden of sauteed seasonal veggies, doused with a light citrus wine sauce. Each bite is an invitation to ponder the transient nature of existence and the beauty of natural potential.

Pasta.name: Pasta Carbonara
Pasta.desc: Sweet, salty and smokey tofu compliments a rich egg sauce with parmigiano reggiano and black pepper.

Pasta.name: Fettuccine Alfredo
Pasta.desc: Nearly found itself on the American part of the menu, least as we commonly encounter this fan favorite dish. Homemade fettuccine is tossed in a garlic cream sauce.

Pasta.name: Sweet Potato Gnocchi
Pasta.desc: A stretch for the pasta menu, this sweet potato gnocchi is cloaked in a truffle rosemary cream sauce, a rich pairing that's often complimented with roasted veggies.

Pasta.name: Pasta al Scottie
Pasta.desc: A supremely simple dish of spaghetti tossed with parmigiano reggiano, pecorino romano, and olive oil. A simpleton as it were, the young lad never shied away from pasta and cheeses.

Pasta.name: Ragu Bianco
Pasta.desc: The sibling of the Bolognese de Tofu, this white version is more creamy, but still packed with flavor!

'Za.name: Classic Pan Pizza
'Za.desc: The first major success with a baking experience, this pan pizza has a delightful and crispy crust, rich tomato sauce to compliement, and of course a melty 5 cheese blend to finish!

'Za.name: White Man in Brussels
'Za.desc: A white sauce forms the foundation of this pizza that includes an asiago blend, roasted Brussels sprouts, broccoli, and kale. Finished with a balsamic glaze drizzle.

'Za.name: Pepperoni Pizza
'Za.desc: The only thing with meat on this menu for now... The classic college experience of red sauce, cheese, and pepperoni (though we find this one is a bit elevated).

'Za.name: A Rick's Favorite Calzone
'Za.desc: Some would say a lost art, this different take on pizza is available with your favorite selection of toppings (if you tell us in advance).

Taste the World.name: Stir Fry
Taste the World.desc: A homemade stir fry sauce envelopes noodles, veggies, and a Chinese 5 spice tofu, providing notes of salty and spice amid a subtle sweetness. It's not quite teriyaki, what is it? Not even we can say.

Taste the World.name: Paneer Tiki Masala
Taste the World.desc: Served with jeera rice and homemade naan. One of the few Indian dishes that we know how to make, so please go easy on us.

Taste the World.name: Aloo Gobi
Taste the World.desc: The classic cauliflower and potato side dish from India. We learned this to compliment our other dishes.

Taste the World.name: Fried Rice
Taste the World.desc: The classic staple, born from the common occurrence of leftover rice. Dealer's choice of: classic, pineapple, mango, or curried versions.

Taste the World.name: Thai Yellow Curry
Taste the World.desc: One of the first dishes I sought to make at a high level, this flavorable creamy coconut based curry tops Jasmine rice in what makes for a delightful bowl.

Taste the World.name: Sushi
Taste the World.desc: Delicately handcrafted sushi rolls with tofu, cucumber, carrots, jalapenos, avocado, and sriracha mayo. Also available: avocado roll, spicy avocado roll with more on the way.

Taste of America (the good kind).name: Chipotle Bowls
Taste of America (the good kind).desc: Perhaps Mexican based, perhaps propaganda from some fakenews restaurants. Either way enjoy a honey cholula tofu that sits atop cilantro lime rice, rounded out with roasted veggies, salsa, cheese, yogurt, and a homemade guac!

Taste of America (the good kind).name: Tofu Breakfast Wraps
Taste of America (the good kind).desc: Tofu made to imitate egg paired with breakfast potatoes, cheese, and a spicy sauce. Avocado avilable upon request.

Taste of America (the good kind).name: Tofu Tacos
Taste of America (the good kind).desc: A taco version of the chipotle bowls (without rice, of course), including pickled peppers if desired.

Taste of America (the good kind).name: Philly Cheese''steak''
Taste of America (the good kind).desc: A vegetarian take on the most valuable offering of Philly. Thinly sliced ''steak'' meets sauteed bell pepper and onion with melty provolone. All hosted on freshly baked bread!

Taste of America (the good kind).name: Meatlessball Subs
Taste of America (the good kind).desc: A modern tragedy in the eyes of some, but a staple that powered me through a high school diploma. A rich marinara sauce finds our meatlessballs finished with melty provolone. Made with freshly baked bread and garlic spread!

Taste of America (the good kind).name: Mac and Cheese
Taste of America (the good kind).desc: A delightful homemade take on the dish that so many of us grew up on. Hopefully this one avoids bringing up any childhood trauma.

Chef's Special Menu.name: Tofu Deli Style Sandwich
Chef's Special Menu.desc: They said it couldn't be done, yet I did it. The trick? Shaved tofu, uncooked and seasoned makes the base of this sandwich with balsamic glaze, tomatoes, mozzarella, and cucumber. As odd as it sounds, it's worth trying once!

Chef's Special Menu.name: Fried Tofu Sandwich
Chef's Special Menu.desc: Emboldened by the deli sandwich, we sought a unique experience of fried tofu paired with a simple Asian style sauce, and slap this between two slices of homemade bread. If you didn't like the first rendition, this one is better.

Chef's Special Menu.name: Buffalo Tofu Sliders
Chef's Special Menu.desc: The third entry in our tofu sandwich series is curated from our Buffalo tofu, cheddar cheese, cucumbers, and vegan mayo. It may not be chicken, but it's pretty damn delicious!

Chef's Special Menu.name: Tofu Cutlet Marinara
Chef's Special Menu.desc: The fourth entry and the most popular of our tofu sandwiches, a tofu cutlet is met with our rich marinara sauce, finished with provolone.

Coming Soon....name: Mapo Tofu
Coming Soon....desc: Coming soon, our (vegetarian) take on a famous Chinese dish.

Coming Soon....name: Buffalo Mac and Cheese
Coming Soon....desc: Tofu prepared with the classic flavors of Buffalo sauce before finding themselves atop a delightful mac and cheese.

Coming Soon....name: Tofu fries
Coming Soon....desc: Tofu is tossed in a spice blend before being pan fried to golden perfection, served with a side of sriracha-mayo for dipping.

Coming Soon....name: Bagels
Coming Soon....desc: The New York classic! A beautiful bagel, choice of: Everything, Rosemary and Salt, Salt, and Sesame Seed.

Coming Soon....name: JA Pizza
Coming Soon....desc: A buffalo tofu pizza that is almost as interesting at the MVP himself.
